questions.question: In recursion, the condition for which the function will stop calling itself is ____________

explanations.a: For recursion to end at some point, there always has to be a condition for which the function will not call itself. This condition is known as base case.

questions.question: Recursion is a method in which the solution of a problem depends on ____________

answers.b: Larger instances of the same problem
answers.c: Smaller instances of the same problem

explanations.c: In recursion, the solution of a problem depends on the solution of smaller instances of the same problem.

questions.question: Recursion is similar to which of the following?

explanations.b: Recursion is similar to a loop

questions.question: A recursive function without if and else conditions will always lead to?
Which of the following is true?

answers.a: Recursion is always better than iteration
answers.b: Recursion uses more memory compared to iteration
answers.c: Recursion uses less memory compared to iteration
answers.d: Iteration is always better and simpler than recursion

explanations.b: Recursion uses more memory compared to iteration because every time the recursive function is called, the function call is stored in stack
